Authors: Gutandjala I.I., Gui A., Maryam S., Mariani V.
Title: Information System Risk Assessment and Management (Study Case at XYZ University)
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2019
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Information Systems Audit Program, Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Gutandjala, I.I., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Gui, A., Information Systems Audit Program, Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Maryam, S., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Mariani, V., Information Systems Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Information system risk assessment case studies based on information assets that need to be mapped in detail, this case study has been conducted at XYZ University in the directorate of online learning. There is a need for the application of a risk management information system for information asset security and has to be designed to identify risks and problems that exist at the online learning especially. Information system risk assessment must be watched out for because it can threaten the integrity, confidentiality, and availability of online learning activity and through this qualitative research which uses the OCTAVE ALLEGRO framework, critical assets can be identified together with the proposed prevention approach. © 2019 IEEE.

Authors: Maryam S., Murad D.F., Fernando E., Dewi M.A., Murmanto I.R., Sunardi
Title: Evaluate Implementation of Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) System
Source title: Proceedings of 2018 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2018
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Information Systems Department, BINUS Online Learning Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Information System Department, Tanri Abeng University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Maryam, S., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Murad, D.F., Information Systems Department, BINUS Online Learning Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Fernando, E., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Dewi, M.A., Information System Department, Tanri Abeng University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Murmanto, I.R., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Sunardi, Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: This study aims to evaluate the successful implementation of ERP system that has been done in the Ministry of Finance Unit. The research methodology is that would be used is literature, collect data sample and data analysis. Method collected data sample with observation and questionnaire. Method data analysis using factor analysis. Method the results obtained from this study is the analysis of new factors and indicators that can be used as a basis for determining that the effect of a successful ERP implementation. Data obtained from questionnaires to 120 respondents in Ministry of Finance unit. Data can be processed from the 92 questionnaire respondents. Data were analyzed using reliability and factor analysis method after that proceed by using regression analysis. Results obtained in the form of a new model that can be used by the Finance Ministry is to evaluate the success of ERP Systems implementation. By using the new model of successful ERP System Implementation evaluate this, we can determine the minimum and maximum values that affect the successful of ERP system implementation to make a reference to improvement and development process of the system for the better system ahead. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: enterprise resources planning; evaluation; factor analysis; regression analysis; successful system implementation
